page.title: 19 Mockbeggar Stud,Wellow
page.content: Mockbeggar Stud is on the edge of the New Forest,in Penn Common.It has 16 acres divided into fields, with a cottage and stable yard in the middle. Mrs.Bennet takes her produce of cattle, sheep and pigs to Salisbury market and sells her foals from the stud.There is little profit in this business. Mrs.Bennet rises at six a.m.,feeds the horses,then mucks out,whilst her husband feeds the pigs;then she milks the Jersey cow.Breakfast begins.She then starts the house work.With the girl from the Youth Training Scheme, she exercises the horses until 3.00p.m. Then the pigs are fed and cows are milked.Horses are mucked out and bedded down.Mrs.Bennet finds her work very rewarding. By Jessice Bartlett,Sasha Hopper,Bonamy Godfrey,Heidi Banger.
